medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began with acute-onset RUQ > epigastric abdominal pain after eating pizza the day prior to presentation. The pain has persisted and slightly improved compared to the time of onset, but has not resolved. The patient had a brief episode of nausea and emesis x 1 five days prior, which self-resolved and had no associated abdominal pain. She has had no associated nausea or vomiting since the onset of the current symptoms.
